intro: Struthanthus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows, hibiscus, and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Struthanthus microphyllus is often found in rocky slopes and dry washes, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
